page.title: 19Law and Order, Wye Valley.
page.content: A local police constable was interviewed to find out about life as a policeman and law and order in this area. The type of work that the P.C. does is patrolling the main streets of Monmouth, controlling traffic, attending road accidents, visiting schools, advising on shop security, arresting shoplifters, keeping public order and visiting scenes of burglaries. There are about 25 police men stationed at Monmouth. The main crimes committed in this area are poaching salmon from the River Wye and deer. The other main crime is burglary. Poachers catch the salmon by spreading large nets across the river at night. They sell the salmon to hotels and public houses. Burglaries are common because of the high number of isolated houses and because it is an affluent area.
